original_title: Sri Lanka president’s loyalist Navin Dissanayake appointed provincial governor
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka President Ranil Wickremesinghe has appointed party stalwart and former minister Navin Dissanayake as Governor of the Sabaragamuwa Province.

“I will bring 20 years of experience to improve the public delivery systems in the province and bring much needed reforms in the education sector,” Dissanayake tweeted hours after his appointment on Tuesday June 13.

Dissanayake is a senior member of Wickremesinghe’s United National Party (UNP) and one of the few seniors to not join the breakaway Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) led by former UNP deputy leader Sajith Premadasa who now leads the opposition.
Amid speculation of early presidential elections, political analysts say the president is keen to strengthen the UNP ahead of whatever election is called in the coming months. (Colombo/Jun13/2023)
